facts.1: Portugal Day, also known as Dia de Portugal, is celebrated on June 10th to honor the death of national literary icon Luís de Camões.
facts.2: The day is marked by various cultural events, parades, and official ceremonies, including the presence of the President of Portugal.
facts.3: Portuguese communities around the world also celebrate this day with traditional music, dance, and cuisine.

facts.1: Herbs and Spices Day celebrates the diverse and flavorful world of culinary herbs and spices, which have been used for thousands of years in cooking and medicine.
facts.2: Popular herbs include basil, parsley, and rosemary, while common spices include cinnamon, turmeric, and black pepper.
facts.3: The day encourages people to explore new flavors and incorporate more herbs and spices into their meals for health benefits and enhanced taste.

facts.1: Iced Tea Day celebrates the refreshing and versatile beverage that can be enjoyed in various flavors and styles, from sweet tea to herbal iced tea.
facts.2: The origins of iced tea date back to the early 19th century, with the first known recipe appearing in an American cookbook in 1879.
facts.3: Iced tea is particularly popular in the southern United States, where sweet tea is a staple at many gatherings and meals.
